SEARCH
Package netApi

Class ClientSideConnection

java.lang.Object
netApi.ClientSideConnection
public abstract class ClientSideConnection extends Object
The client-side version of a client.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ClientSideConnection()
    Creates a new LocalClient

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientSideConnection

      public ClientSideConnection() throws IOException
      Creates a new LocalClient
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

  • Method Details

    • joinServer

      public void joinServer(InetSocketAddress ip) throws IOException, ServerTypeMismatchException
      Joins the Server denoted by the address ip.
      Parameters:
      ip - Ip address of server being joined
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs
      ServerTypeMismatchException - If the server type does not match the client type

    • authenticate

      public void authenticate(SocketChannel in)
      Method used to authenticate the client when connecting to a Server for security and to make sure that the client is connecting to the right kind of Server. This correlates to Server's Server.serverSideAuth(SocketChannel) method. This method is currently undefined, and you should define it if you want added security to your program.
      Parameters:
      in - SocketChannel the client is attempting to connect to

    • joinServer

      public boolean joinServer(String code) throws IOException, ServerTypeMismatchException
      Joins the server denoted by the code
      Parameters:
      code - Code associated with the Server's ip address and port
      Returns:
      Whether the server was successfully joined
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs
      ServerTypeMismatchException - If the server type does not match the client type

    • joinServer

      public boolean joinServer(InetAddress address, int port) throws IOException, ServerTypeMismatchException
      Joins the server at the denoted ip address and port
      Parameters:
      address - The Server's ip address
      port - The Server's port
      Returns:
      Whether the server was successfully joined
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs
      ServerTypeMismatchException - If the server type does not match the client type

    • serverSearch

      public void serverSearch() throws IOException
      Sends out a request for public Servers. Public servers that respond will be received through receiveServerInfo(InetSocketAddress, byte[])
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • inServer

      public boolean inServer()
      Returns whether the client is currently connected to a server.
      Returns:
      Whether the client is currently connected to a server.

    • getUdpPort

      public DatagramChannel getUdpPort()
      Returns the port used for auto-detecting public servers
      Returns:
      Client's Udp port for searching for public servers

    • leaveServer

      public void leaveServer() throws IOException
      Leaves the server the client is connected to (if they're connected at all)
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • leaveServer

      public void leaveServer(String in, boolean forced) throws IOException
      Leaves the server the client is connected to (if they're connected at all)
      Parameters:
      in - The reason for the server leaving (null if none is provided)
      forced - Whether the server leaving was forced
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • getClientType

      public abstract int getClientType()
      Returns the type associated with the client. This should match the type of the Server that the client wants to connect to (Server.getServerType() in the correlating Server class).
      Returns:
      Type associated with client

    • send

      public void send(Object o) throws IOException
      Sends the Server the Object o, automatically parsing it if it is a primitive or a String
      Parameters:
      o - Data to send to the Server
      Throws:
      IOException - If any I/O errors occur

    • receiveInt

      public abstract void receiveInt(int in)
      Fires when the client receives data in the form of an Integer, this is where you should handle incoming data
      Parameters:
      in - The Integer received by the client

    • receiveChar

      public abstract void receiveChar(char in)
      Fires when the client receives data in the form of an Character, this is where you should handle incoming data
      Parameters:
      in - The Character received by the client

    • receiveLong

      Fires when the client receives data in the form of an Long, this is where you should handle incoming data
      Parameters:
      in - The Long received by the client

      Parameters:
      in - The Double received by the client

      Fires when the client receives data in the form of an Byte, this is where you should handle incoming data
      Parameters:
      in - The Byte received by the client

      public abstract void receiveBool(boolean in)
      Fires when the client receives data in the form of an Boolean, this is where you should handle incoming data
      Parameters:
      in - The Boolean received by the client

      public abstract void receiveString(String in)
      Fires when the client receives data in the form of an String, this is where you should handle incoming data
      Parameters:
      in - The String received by the client

    • receiveObject

      public abstract void receiveObject(Object in)
      Fires when the client receives data in the form of an Object, this is where you should handle incoming data
      Parameters:
      in - The Object received by the client

    • leftServer

      public abstract void leftServer(String in, boolean forced)
      Fires when client leaves or is kicked from a server, this is where you should handle when the client leaves a server
      Parameters:
      in - The reason that the client is no longer connected, null if none was provided
      forced - False if the client left voluntarily (through a call to leaveServer()), and true if the client's connection was closed forcibly (For instance through the Server on the other end being closed)

    • receiveServerInfo

      public abstract void receiveServerInfo(InetSocketAddress address, byte[] data)
      Fires when client receives information about a public server, this is where you should handle incoming public server data
      Parameters:
      address - The address of the server that data was received from
      data - The data received from the server

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Closes the client, meaning it cannot be used again unless reopen() is called. Any attempts to use the client to manage connections will throw a ClientClosedException until reopen() is called.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O exception occurs

    • isClosed

      public boolean isClosed()
      Returns whether the client has been closed. If it has, and you would like to open it again you can call reopen().
      Returns:
      Whether the client is closed

    • reopen

      public void reopen() throws IOException
      Reopens the client after close() is called.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O exception occurs
